text: William Richard "Bill" Mitchell (February 22, 1930 - April 1, 2014) was a Canadian professional ice hockey defenceman and coach. He played one in the National Hockey League (NHL) during the 1963-64 season for the Detroit Red Wings. He later coached some teams in Toledo, Ohio in the United States. He was born in Port Dalhousie, Ontario. Mitchell died from kidney failure on April 1, 2014 in Perrysburg Township, Wood County, Ohio. He was 84 years old. He was outlived by his one daughter and two sons. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1930 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey coaches Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:Deaths from renal failure Category:Detroit Red Wings players Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:International Hockey League (1945â€“2001) players Category:Central Professional Hockey League players Category:Eastern Hockey League players
title: Bill Mitchell (ice hockey)
